pros: Schedule was 4pm-7pm, perfect for those in school!
cons: Weekends required, as expected for most jobs.

pros: Working with the kids is very rewarding.
cons: Don't critique management ever. They will skirt what is right and use loop holes any time they need to but then if they want you gone for speaking too loud they will let you do all that to turn around and use it against you. They won't defend you in any situation but will only look for what you did wrong. The work is IMPOSSIBLE so everyone work off the clock to not get fired - you will say you won't but you will soon realize there is no other way to do it so make sure the pay is something you are ready to work 50 hours for, not 40.

pros: - focused on leadership development - employee engagement committee
cons: - lower wages - paid time off could be more

review_title: Not a mental health provider of choice
pros: The work isn't for everyone; but it is rewarding if you have a passion for community mental health. Benefits are reasonable; and a generous amount of PLT is given. State retirement is a perk. Facility is being modernized, and while under construction; will be state of the art in all areas in about a year or so.
cons:
Managers don't stay long, often less than 2 years. Pay was boosted for "market wage", yet in some categories the organization ranks on the lower end in terms of comparable employers. Nurses and CNAs are well paid; however they struggle to find applicants despite ranking near the top of comparable employers. Managers rarely help om the floor; and never volunteer to help after hours shifts. No night Managers on site; only available by phone; which commonly means waking someone up. Many in the organization either fail or directly contradict the organization core values of Dignity, Integrity, Accountability, Partnership, and Continuous improvement. The organizational culture drives the good, passionate people in the organization to leave.

Organization is without permanent executive director. Michael Loy was let go and the organization has not had a permanent executive director in over a year.

pros: Your co worker are nice
cons: They mandate you a lot so be ready

review_title: Love my job, my supervisors support is lacking
pros:
Making a difference in the lives of others,  most of the supervisors are wonderful.  Great coworkers, we are a family.
Good medical insurance with a Health reimbursement account
cons:
HR does not back up the employees
Have taken away alot of benefits recently
Upper management says they want to keep employees informed but are very selective in what they actually tell you leaving employees to not trust them
There have been alot of jobs eliminated, and people are on edge each day not knowing if it is your last day.
They seem to eliminate positions of people who use the insurance
The CEO does not seem to care about the clients that loose support as programs are cut nor about employees..all just a number.

pros: Retirement an being able to use the pool is the only good thing a bout working in an abusive relationship that I the Health Care Center.
cons: Working at the Health Care Center is like being in an abusive relationship, you have your favorites, and they tell on you if they don't like you, the favorites sometime get to learn new jobs and improve their jobs, you are afraid to talk to go workers, and you do not get praised for good work but certainly get told if you make a mistake, also you have to watch out for black listing that will happen too by supervisors and the CEO.  When you try to communicate with outside County officials you get told off. Employees are not appreciated. They also need to take better care of the mentally ill and not send them to an emergency room. Your Job is to take care of them not the emergency room at the Hospital.

review_title: It has it's pro's and con's
pros: Constant contact with nurses. Ability to communicate with management re: changes needed in various parts of organization. Some of the best personal care workers in the area. Chance for real medical care training. Decent wages.
cons: Lousy health insurance with much too high of a deductible for CNA wages. Lack of managerial investing in PLT time; PLT time could ...and should... be used more effectively and more highly valued to help students, workers with health issues, and COVID 19's effects. Lack of creative use of nursing management resources when faced with inevitable and constant staffing issues.

pros: Some great people who truly do care about helping others but too few of.
cons: THINK TWICE BEFORE WORKING IN BEHAVIORAL HEALTH!!! Very hostile working environment. Tons of favortism, neptuism pervails rampantly throughout this whole sector of the organization. Marathon County Board needs to seriously dig deeper into this facility's management practices and herd mentality that predominates this facility. If they really want to service and provide quality healthcare services to the tri county commmunity, then they need to start asking the right people which are past employees what they know from their personal experiences what is really going on within that facility. Then they'll have their answers to turning it around to positivity and a place people want to work for. Get rid of your neptuism and sub standard nursing manager whom is at the root of tremendous chaos and who will do and say what she can to save her own back and the backs of her close family members working under her.This is the only facility where relatives are reporting off to superiors and causing tremendous chaos and telling multiple lies to cover their own behinds and jobs and placing blame on the good employees who then end up loosing theirs or quit because they know they are fighting a loosing upward battle. EMPLOYEES  voicing valid concerns eqates to retalitory actions of being unjustly reprimanded and eventually being terminated or quitting. These same employees made HR more then aware of what was transpiring within and nothing was done.
